snippet: The election commission said Saturday that Uhuru Kenyatta had received 50.07 percent of the vote, but the other top contender, Raila Odinga, indicated that he would not concede defeat.
abstract: Kenya’s election commission declares Uhuru Kenyatta, son of Kenya’s first president and one of the prime suspects in a case involving crimes against humanity, to be the winner of the country’s presidential race; declaration comes amid growing allegations of vote fraud and a refusal by his opponent Raila Odinga to concede.
lead_paragraph: The election commission said Saturday that Uhuru Kenyatta had received 50.07 percent of the vote, but the other top contender, Raila Odinga, indicated that he would not concede defeat.

headline.main: Kenyatta Is Declared the Victor in Kenya, but Opponent Plans to Appeal
headline.print_headline: Kenyatta Is Declared the Victor in Kenya, but Opponent Plans to Appeal

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
